job_title: Client Servies in San Jose, CA
pros: overall good for atmosphere and people
cons: none at this time now

job_title: Patient Business Service Clerk in San Jose, CA
pros: Great coworkers, everyone has a positive attitude and are generally friendly and welcoming. I feel that while hospitals can be a hectic place to work everyone ive worked with has a great attitude and wants to be there. The pay is decent and benefits are great.
cons: County hospital, systems are not fully up to date or accurate which makes things a bit tedious at times. Change can be slow.

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT) in San Jose, CA
pros: Coming from a larger hospital, this place is much slower paced. It’s nice not to be at a trauma hospital.
cons: The person who takes care of payroll seems to do unnecessary steps. Very particular in how things are done. Clocking in and out should be enough like it’s sister hospitals.

job_title: Clinical Dietitian I in San Jose, CA
pros: Friendly coworkers, good benefits, free food
cons: Management knows we are understaffed but does not try very hard to get new employees

job_title: Hsa II in San Jose, CA
pros: Nice friendly staff, very welcoming
cons: I can’t really think of any cons

job_title: Dietetic Assistant in San Jose, CA
pros: County Benefits, great union, flexible schedule
cons: Hard to get coded position with benefits

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Delhi, NY
pros: Beautiful setting in a rural area, nice to live.
cons: Rural area has little to offer to young families.

job_title: Medical Laboratory Assistant in San Jose, CA
pros: Nice people. Good management. Need connection.
cons: It's hard to switch department. Need connection.

job_title: Registered Nurse, Clinical Nurse III in San Jose, CA
pros: Excellent benefits, competitive pay, small hospital.
cons: Older facility needs renovation. Rooms old too.

job_title: Hospital Service Assistant in San Jose, CA
pros: Great Teamwork, Very Good Management
cons: Not enough staffing at times

review_title: Structured and pleasant working environment and a  Great friendly place.
job_title: Executive Assistant in San Jose, CA
pros: Staff is great, and the management is very friendly.  They are all about helping you achieve the best you can be.
cons: Due to it being a non-profit organization, my job was phased out. Another position under my same supervisor was available just I was being laid off however the position was posted that a college degree was required. Though I have over 20 years experience in this "posted"  position, i was overlooked for someone else who had just a  AA degree in a unrelated field, but they got the job.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Jose, CA
pros: Use to be a nice lovely Catholic Hospital. Pay is alright. Employees are the best! Great Doctors.
cons: Just bought out by a Hedge fund! Unhappy employees, low moral. Management sucks, too many changes and too many cutbacks! Very bad union contract with SEIU, they really screwed the employees and we can't get rid of them. This place is worse than the COUNTY hospital! I would not come here as a patient. Verity all about $$, rather cutback than focus on patient safety! I had plans of retirement with O'Connor but now am currently looking for new opportunity due to uncertainty of hospital.

job_title: Medical Receptionist in Delhi, NY
pros: Very friendly environment both to patients and employees. Everyone is willing to go above and beyond for patients needs. The medical is professional yet inviting and soothing to patients, especially those in the emergency room. O'Connor is a small satellite hospital with a fully staffed emergency room, located in the Catskills. The hospital has a med surge floor and rehabilitation unit. As well as specialty services and ambulatory. Basically, it's a one stop shop for the neighboring towns.
cons: Need to offer more specialty services, hire more primary care doctors. Upper management needs to be more receptive of the employees.

job_title: Staff RN in San Jose, CA
pros: Great benefits, great pay. Looks perfect on paper.   Perhaps other units are different than the one I chose.
cons: Specific staff members running department, childish  favoritisms and bullying history of newly hired employees, ineffective communication between members of team, very little if any collaboration between staff members  and a general attitude of "not my patient, not my problem " with priorities task-driven rather than patient's best interest or quality of care.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Jose, CA
pros: Nurses generally have great team work
cons:
too many changes to a unit every time a new manager or director come aboard 
keeps the moral on the unit at a very low point.

job_title: Registered Nurse in San Jose, CA
pros: The staff here are great and like working as a team... You can always find help if you need it.
cons: As with any nursing job sometimes the hours can be long, the days can be hard, the demands overwhelming...but fellow staff are there for you.

review_title: Micromanagement and not enough respect for others
job_title: in San Jose, CA
pros: Mid level employees were great. They work hard.
cons: Executive team makes too much money and cut the jobs of nurses that really deserve it.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Jose, CA
pros: Close, family like working environment since it's a smaller non profit  hospital
cons: Due to non profit type of industry, I had to use my own PTO time to cover for holidays. They're not paid for like other places.

job_title: Radiologic Technologist in San Jose, CA
pros: Smaller hospital was more like a family...staff is way to get along with from department to department
cons: Had to sell to huge management investing company to avoid bankruptcy

review_title: settling down after years long stress
job_title: Registered Nurse in San Jose, CA
pros: Stable RN staff, or at least it used to be, salary is competitive
cons: Poor retirement benefits, lots of turnover in management and nursing staff

job_title: Sterile Processing Technician in San Jose, CA
pros: Great working surrounding. Fast paced and professional area
cons: Not a high paced hospital stoill good place to work at because you still get paid

job_title: Volunteer in San Jose, CA
pros: Everyone is super friendly! The hospital has a great atmosphere and everyone genuinely cares about the patients!
cons: I cant think of any cons.
